intro: Pseudomelissitus dasycarpus, commonly known as the hairy fruit bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by distinctive hairy, spherical fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
